newsitem.title: GERMANY: Thyssen steel production halted by meeting.
newsitem.headline: Thyssen steel production halted by meeting.

text.p: Most of Thyssen AG's steel production has been stopped due to workers' protests against a takeover bid by rival Krupp AG, a spokesman for Thyssen's works council said on Wednesday.
Even the blast furnace in Duisburg Beekerwerth, which is currently working as normal, will be run down to emergency operation during the morning because of planned worker meetings today.
Thyssen workers had staged vigils outside factory gates at seven locations throughout the night, the spokesman said.
Thyssen's management will inform employees of the takeover bid by Fried. Krupp AG Hoesch-Krupp at a meeting in the Rhein-Ruhr convention centre in Duisburg on Wednesday.
The company has had to convene two separate meetings, one in the morning and one in the afternoon, because the hall only has capacity for 4,000 people.
Krupp on Tuesday launched a rare 13.6 billion-mark ($8.1 billion) hostile takeover bid, offering 435 marks per Thyssen share.
The offer sparked an angry response from Thyssen, which recommended that shareholders do nothing while it prepared its response to the unwelcome bid.
Steel workers fearing massive job cuts downed tools in angry protest on Tuesday throughout the Ruhr Valley, Germany's industrial heartland.
